intro: Tadehagi andamanicum, commonly known as the Andaman wild pea, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
